Author: Melissa Snover
Post Text: Today, I am delighted to announce REM3DY Health Group's partnership with UPSA, a distinguished pharmaceutical enterprise in Europe with a heritage of 85 years of unparalleled expertise in family medication, led by Isabelle Van Rycke.Since we first met in Paris in May 2022, I have been consistently impressed with UPSA’s remarkable agility, meticulous attention to detail and unwavering focus on improving their customers' lives.It has been a privilege to work with Isabelle and her team on this groundbreaking project, and I am honoured to now reveal the launch of our new range of high-impact nutrient ‘stacks’, which are now live and available across France and Italy in pharmacies nationwide.

Author: Melissa Snover
Post Text: I was delighted to be in Japan last week with the Get Nourish3d team to launch our first-ever pop-up store in one of the world's busiest districts, Shibuya Scramble Square (2nd floor), Tokyo.Shibuya district has 2.1m people pass through its stations each day and is a hub for youth, diversity, technology, and culture. Author: Melissa Snover
Post Text: A question I always get asked is what my morning routine looks like. I'm a big believer that how we start our day sets the tone for the rest of it, so I try to make the most of my mornings. Here's how my typical morning goes: - 4 am: I wake up early and gather my thoughts for the day ahead. With a business and three children to look after, I don’t get much time to myself. Waking up before everyone else gives me an opportunity to prioritise myself and prepare for the day.  - 4:30 am: I typically do a 7-minute workout routine. I have been doing these quick workouts for years now and find them to be extremely effective in keeping my body fit and energised! - 5 am: After my workout, I spend some time catching up on emails and writing out a list of what I will achieve that day.  - 6 am: I will either take my dog for a walk or a run.  - 6:30 am: Once I’m back home, I take a quick shower and get ready. - 7:15 am: I start work! What does your morning routine usually look like? Let me know below.

Author: Melissa Snover
Post Text: A study from the European Journal of Social Psychology found that it takes around 66 days to form a habit and get it to stick, which means, for those of you looking to cement New Year's Resolutions into your everyday routine, the goal is March 6th.James Clear’s technique of Habit Stacking is a great way to help, whether you are looking to make progress on a new business idea, taking your Nourished stacks or reading more often. Author: Melissa Snover
Post Text: Last week, I had the privilege of attending the FII Institute Priority Summit in Miami, themed ‘On The Edge of a New Frontier’. This event brought together over 800 attendees including global leaders, investors, CEOs, entrepreneurs, and innovators, all converging to share insights and ideas aimed at shaping the future of business and society.The distinguished panellists included the likes of Stephen A. Schwarzman (Chairman and CEO of The Blackstone Group) and Marcelo Claure (CEO of Claure Group). Particularly striking was Marcelo Claure's summary of the transformative effects of AI, where he highlighted how, just as the internet dramatically reduced the cost of accessing information, #AI is poised to make creativity, cognition, and problem-solving equally accessible, virtually bringing their net cost to zero. Other key discussions pointed towards the necessity for a sustainable financial marketplace blueprint, concerns around the growing cost of living crisis, navigating the challenges of a green energy transition costing between $100-300 trillion by 2050, and leveraging deep tech markets, which is expected to soar as we move forward.  I am grateful for the opportunity to have been involved and wanted to thank Fii for hosting an event filled with inspirational panels and insightful sessions. I am excited about the potential impacts of these discussions on our future and look forward to next year's event.#FIIPriority

Post Text: It was a pleasure to attend the SME Department for Business and Trade Business Connect event in Coventry yesterday and learn more about the government's latest set of initiatives to support SMEs. The highlight for me was undoubtedly the Prime Minister's announcement of the Invest In Women Taskforce. This pioneering initiative, led by Hannah Bernard OBE of Barclays Business Banking and the esteemed entrepreneur Debbie Wosskow, OBE, aims to establish the largest fund dedicated to supporting female founders. Its ambition is to make the UK the best place in the world for women to start and grow a business. As a female entrepreneur myself, I am convinced that if successful, this could significantly bolster the UK economy and afford our nation a distinctive competitive edge internationally.

Author: Melissa Snover
Post Text: According to the World Health Organisation, PCOS is a significant problem that affects an estimated 8-13% of women of productive age, and up to 70% of cases go undiagnosed.  At Get Nourish3d, we are committed to supporting women suffering from the uncomfortable symptoms that come with PCOS. That’s why we introduced Inositol into our Nourished stack offering, which can help to:- Restore ovarian activity/regularity- Increase fertility- Improve the regularity of the menstrual cycle - Has a beneficial effect on the metabolic profile of women with PCOS- Regulates insulin levels and reduces blood pressure You can learn more on the following link:https://lnkd.in/edyciX36

Author: Melissa Snover
Post Text: As a Tech Nation ambassador, this week I had the privilege of attending an exclusive event hosted by Tech Nation and Founders Forum Group. It was a moment to reflect on their recent partnership and its potential to further empower UK tech entrepreneurs. Over the past decade, Tech Nation has been instrumental in establishing the UK as a leading digital economy in Europe and the third globally. Their programs have been a cornerstone for growth, connecting talents and transforming startups into success stories. Remarkably, a third of all UK tech unicorns have passed through one of their programmes, highlighting the impactful work they do. Sharing the space with fellow entrepreneurs, including Carolyn Dawson and Brent Hoberman, and discussing Tech Nation’s vision for the future was both an honour and a responsibility I am proud to be a part of. It offered us a chance to contribute our insights towards shaping an ambitious path forward for Tech Nation. I'm grateful for the opportunity to be part of this conversation and look forward to what lies ahead for the UK tech sector.#TechNation #Innovation #StartUpCulture #UKTech

Author: Melissa Snover
Post Text: A recent study by the University College London has unveiled that inadequate sleep is costing the UK economy a staggering £40 billion each year. Sleep is a key pillar of both physical and mental health, and the consequences of poor sleep extend beyond just individual well-being, as evidenced by the study. Proper nutrition, involving high-impact nutrients, vitamins, and superfoods, can play a vital role in mitigating the adverse effects of poor sleep – especially when we take the time to understand our bodies and make informed, personalised decisions.My comments and thoughts on this study have been featured in over 100 different press publications in the last week. You can find out more and read it here:https://lnkd.in/eyhM4rnH

Author: Melissa Snover
Post Text: This week is Mental Health Awareness week in the UK. At Get Nourish3d, we believe that mental health should be a priority every day, so I wanted to share some tips and tools that could help your Inner Peace:- Many studies show that exercise can help with anxiety, sleep deprivation, and mood swings. - Try to stimulate the vagus nerve system, which can activate a sense of relaxation in the body and tackle feelings of stress. Try humming, laughing, cold water exposure, or breathing exercises.- Writing down your thoughts and feelings.- Keep in touch with family and friends as much as possible.- Certain superfoods and vitamins have been known to help combat stress, anxiety, and depression, such as Scutell'Up, Ashwagandha, Maca Powder, and Ginseng.You can read more about this topic and the above ingredients from the Nourished blog here: https://lnkd.in/eRwnXdRT
